alert.note: Alert for Boone; Campbell; Gallatin; Grant; Kenton (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 18 at 1:11PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Northern Kentucky, including the following counties, Boone, Campbell, Gallatin, Grant and Kenton. * WHEN...Until 415 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 110 PM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain due to showers. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Alexandria, Walton, Claryville, Crittenden, Cold Spring, Piner, Atwood, Bracht, Fiskburg, Morning View, White Villa, Verona, Visalia, Munk, Grants Lick, Ryle, Aspen Grove, Campbell County Lake, US Routes 42 and 127 at State Route 562 and Gubser Mill.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
